content: {{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-263-03-B |Item_parent=Vascular nephropathy |Item_parent_short=Vascular nephropathy |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the causes of thrombotic microangiopathy |Description=None |Rubric=Etiologies |Contributors=Jean-Jacques Boffa |Order=3}} Causes of MAT syndrome {| class="wikitable" |Typical (post-diarrhoeal) enterobacteria producing "Shiga-like toxins" (SLT): E.Coli O157:H7, Salmonella, Shigella... |- |Atypical HUS: mutation of genes coding for complement proteins (complement C3, factor H, factor I, CD46), or anti-factor H antibodies, mutation of the thrombomodulin gene, etc. |- |Infections: septicaemia, HIV virus, H1N1 influenza |- |Medications: mitomycin C, gemcitabine, cyclosporine, tacrolimus, anti-VEGF |- |Malignant hypertension |- |Eclampsia |- |Dysimmune disease: scleroderma, systemic lupus erythematosus, anti-phospholipid syndrome |- |Cancer |- |Thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura: anti-ADAMTS13 (von Willebrand factor protease) autoantibodies or ADAMTS13 genetic deficiency |}

question.title: What is a common cause of thrombotic microangiopathy (TMA)?

option_a.title: Infections: septicaemia, HIV virus, H1N1 influenza
option_a.description: Option A: Infections are a common cause of TMA

option_b.title: Malignant hypertension
option_b.description: Option B: Malignant hypertension is a common cause of TMA

option_c.title: Dysimmune disease: scleroderma, systemic lupus erythematosus, anti-phospholipid syndrome
option_c.description: Option C: Dysimmune disease is a common cause of TMA

option_d.title: Thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura: anti-ADAMTS13 (von Willebrand factor protease) autoantibodies or ADAMTS13 genetic deficiency
option_d.description: Option D: TTP is a common cause of TMA
